project.description:
This is a multi-CSV data loader optimized to conserve memory. It is currently configured to run on an 8G heap.
This job will load data found in the local directory $DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR/hpds_input. The loader will scan the directory, and load all CSV files. When this job completes successfully, it will move any existing HPDS phenotype data to a backup directory "$DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR/hpds_bak", and the new data will be placed in "$DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR/hpds/". The "Start PIC-SURE" job needs to be run after this job completes to refresh the HPDS data volume mount and allow PIC-SURE to access the new data.
Each CSV file must start with a header line, exactly matching this string:
"PATIENT_NUM","CONCEPT_PATH","NVAL_NUM","TVAL_CHAR","TIMESTAMP"
Each subsequent row in the data file or the SQL result must contain the following entries to match the header columns:
PATIENT_NUM: This is an integer value identifying the subject of the recorded observation fact.
CONCEPT_PATH: This is an identifier for the concept of the observation fact. For compatibility with the PIC-SURE UI this path should represent a location in a hierarchy where each level is separated by a backslash and with a leading and trailing backslash, e.g., "\demographics\AGE\".
NVAL_NUM: A numeric value if this is a numeric concept, otherwise blank.
TVAL_CHAR: A text value if this is a categorical concept, otherwise blank.
TIMESTAMP: A timestamp for the observation fact, this should be expressed as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT. This is equivalent to the Unix Epoch time value for the time of the observation multiplied by 1000.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
export PROFILING_OPTS="-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9000 -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=localhost"
docker stop hpds-etl && docker rm hpds-etl
rm -rf /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp rm -rf /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_bak mkdir -p /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp
#generate a new encryption key openssl enc -aes-128-cbc -k secret -P | grep key | cut -d '=' -f2 > /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp/encryption_key
docker run --name=hpds_data_load_multiple_csv \ -v $DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR/hpds_temp:/opt/local/hpds \ -v $DOCKER_CONFIG_DIR/hpds_input/:/opt/local/hpds_input/ \ -e JAVA_OPTS="-Dlogback.log.level=INFO " \ -e HEAPSIZE=$HEAPSIZE \ -e LOADER_NAME=LowRAMMultiCSVLoader hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds-etl:LATEST && \ mv /usr/local/docker-config/hpds /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_bak && \ mv /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp /usr/local/docker-config/hpds
